comments.body: This seems to be unused - isn't it?

It is used subsequently.  I split many steps like this up to make them
easier to review, that's why a lot of them feel unrelated.  See other
comment about relatedness.

On Tue, Jul 5, 2016 at 4:18 AM, Wojciech Tyczynski <notifications@github.com

> wrote:
> 
> In cmd/libs/go2idl/args/args.go
> https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/pull/25978#discussion_r69546033
> :
> 
> > @@ -61,6 +61,9 @@ type GeneratorArgs struct {
> >     // Package path within the source tree.
> >     OutputPackagePath string
> > -   // Output file name.
> > -   OutputFileBaseName string
> 
> This seems to be unused - isn't it?
> 
> â€”
> You are receiving this because you were mentioned.
> Reply to this email directly, view it on GitHub
> https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/pull/25978/files/042b6cd81b59ba43fee9ab62e1801b6681584472..f5328778be5956ec1237a28c8930e3c2500f023a#r69546033,
> or mute the thread
> https://github.com/notifications/unsubscribe/AFVgVDbsSiF7xQEva2fQIDc82gyNUMX7ks5qSj1vgaJpZM4Ijc3K
> .
This invalidates the comment above for GeneratorArgs. How about changing it to "GeneratorArgs has arguments that need to be passed to generators"?
What if a user doesn't use the `Default()` to generate args? So IMO calling the `AddFlags` in `Execute` is better. [edit] Is there any compelling reason to move `AddFlags` to here?

On second thought, I think the argument can go either way. Users are supposed to call `Default()` to generate the args, and if they don't, probably they don't want to parse the flags either. So LGTM :)
